author: Richard MacMillan

review: Roku has nothing on this little amazing entertainment controller. The user interface is rich vibrant and easy to navigate. If you have ever used a Roku you'll love this product. It improved on everything that was wrong with the Roku. The content menu is easy to navigate and understand. The Netflix app on it is awesome and resembles the game counsels Netflix apps. If your looking for a streaming network entertainment hardware look no further than this awesome little piece of hardware.
author: Michael Williams

review: I have a google chromecast and really like it, so I was excited to get to try this baby out to see how it compares. Let me start with what I didn't like. This took FOREVER to set up. I'm not sure why, but at first, my tv wouldn't recognize it, then once it would, it would not download the necessary updates for it to work. I was also super concerned because when I plugged it in and my tv would read it, there were these green lines across the screen.Finally after about an hour and a half of fiddling with it, it finally downloaded the update and started working. Overall I love the layout of all the apps and services available. Right now I don't have prime video, so I can't take full advantage of the video streaming from Amazon, but I love how easy it is for me to get to my Netflix and Hulu accounts.The remote is also another great addition that the chromecast doesn't have. I love that this is the only thing I need for all my streaming purposes.

author: Wagdi Dessoukey

review: The unit arrived today; so far I am not very happy with it.  First, I hate being required to watch a video to use something.  Next, the time it takes to switch between apps is incredibly slow for a dedicated streaming device.  Third, and I may chalk this up to being a new item and the network being bogged down, but app downloading is painfully slow compared to all of the other devices in my house.On the plus side, having Hulu in another room without having to by a $60 box or use a phone or PC with a chromecast is a big plus.I may update this review if the performance of the unit improves.
author: Amazon Customer

review: What a disappointment!Had Chromecast for months now before getting this 'fire stick' and cannot even begin to compare how superior and better experience the chromecast offers....!!First.. nit-picking... The ac adapter looks nice but the way it is built - you loose at least two other, adjacent, outlet holes on a power strip when you plug it in. No fun. Then the remote is not clear on how to open... which side to slide it toward to open it. I was afraid to break it. Again... nit-picking.Another issue I had was logging into Netflix. Amazon fantastic support chat (didn't even wait for one second) - helped me restart, clear data, restart again, to get it to work... So nice support but why this issue?Second... The more important things:The remote is super slow. searching for something on netflix or youtube is significantly, and painfully, slower when compared to chromecast where you, and even your loved one, can scroll - each on his/her phone, at blazing speed to find something and then boom - play it on the tv.On the fire stick you feel like a grampa... h....o...u...s...e...o... f...c...a...r...d...s... takes eons!I then realized there is an app for the fire stick.. hooray, a savior!The app is useless. Literally. It basically lets you "touch" the screen using your phone. Good luck hitting where you want to.All in all - chromecast only downside is the lack of support for amazon stream. If it had that - then I would have given one star and would say - forget this fire stick. So until then... Fire stick you get two stars. "Good job"
